posts.body:
>>edd06a98-5f32-4355-9f70-116ec163f215
you can save the seed for the user you mong

>>edd06a98-5f32-4355-9f70-116ec163f215
click the user button, click "show master seed" and save that somewhere.
whenever you want that user again, simply click user, log out, and it will prompt you to log in with another user, where you can enter the seed you saved to log back in.

>>9804fe84-d6eb-439e-b16c-13fc14d03b42

this should be unnecessary, and futile, as you will just download them again.

>>50264fa5-b572-4cfa-b99b-f0d9cd25ac22

>>59e34525-3500-4b2f-bab6-5f779e0a1727

posts.subject: important
posts.body:
how to check someone's posting history (on linux)

>move to zeronet/data/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/data/users
>copy a line in one of their posts
>run grep -H "paste line here" */data.json
this should return the id of said poster. after that, you can go to the exact folder and view data.json, where the entire post history is located.

remember to change your id's, anons.

>>0b88fb2e-d3c4-4fec-b0c8-234d8ba574e5
no problem, agent glow.

>>20d7eb99-1c9f-4d9d-815f-8c308380e90d
ive still got your entire post history. you're looking at the wrong thing, friend.
use the plugin i was talking about earlier (multiuser), and maybe give this whole thread a good read.
your ID is 1GRLZWeBAntWNiHgrEdoYWYTwUxsrwfTVi

>>fe53fdae-e945-4a71-96fa-f46b559ebc9a
i hope you're using tor, because if not, with some effort, your ip can be found by those that glow.
so even if i knew how to change your id, it would still be tied to your ip.

>>0e2a4916-f6b9-40dd-b274-6468ea4488e3
yeah, it seems tor users are having a bit of trouble posting pics. i'll look into it.

>>66646012-0c8b-429a-8906-3af323f57979
>Don't fuck around with the multiusers cookie plugin.
why?

>>36ede286-92ca-487e-b8eb-27dba880e4ed
this.
you're MEANT to fuck with the plugins, you're NOT MEANT to fuck with the fucking files.

>>45b8fcb9-1690-4bca-8df1-b5f038f69690
i think you would be fine, but i'd still use tor over a vpn.
tor is available for android, not sure about ishit.

>>2b7292f3-65f7-44bb-b90c-d2617f1af925
>Because if it would be for what you want to use it for, it wouldn't need cookies, it would just change the users.json itself.
I believe i know the reason why this is done, but im not sure.
I think the cookie stops zeronet from changing your id mid-use or something like that. 
>something that is blocked or straight up not accepted in autistic privacy aware browsers.
works fine for me on Tor Browser.

deleting users.json is also a viable solution, but in my opinion the plugin is better.

>>e7ec6897-dd13-425f-9105-3a7eee46986f
go to zeronet/data/users.json and find the master seed.
you have to use that seed if you want to be able to do literally anything.
im not exactly sure how this works

for anons getting "this is not allowed on this proxy" after editing certain settings, you will have to go to users.json, find the master seed and log in with that. that master seed is able to edit anything.
